formattedAddress: 52 Vanderbilt Ave, New York, NY 10017, USA
adrFormatAddress: 52 Vanderbilt Ave, New York, NY 10017-3808, USA

editorialSummary.text: Greek seafood and a deep wine list headline at this airy spot with sandstone pillars.

originalText.text:
This was a great restaurant,  very clean and well presented.  It was quiet when we arrived, but we had an early dinner reservation.  It soon filled up, and the atmosphere was lively. The service was great. Clearly, the staff knew exactly what they were doing and were very attentive, even with my kids, which I loved. They treated the children with the same courtesy  as the adults, and I couldn't have asked for more.
The food was wonderful. I thoroughly enjoyed every bite. It was well cooked and beautifully presented, and it is clear that the people who work here care about what they do!
I would most definitely go back!

originalText.text: Such a beautiful place. The atmosphere is so beautiful. The service was impeccable from the moment we entered the establishment. We waited at the back for our table. The bartender let us sample the wines before we made out choices. The manager walked us to our tables and carried our wine glasses...very classy.  The servers were incredible. Three to a table. The food was delicious. Shout out to the spanikopita, grilled calamari, meatballs and 5 spreads with pita. The wine was delicious. Loved the pink bang rose. Will definitely return.

text.text: Such a beautiful place. The atmosphere is so beautiful. The service was impeccable from the moment we entered the establishment. We waited at the back for our table. The bartender let us sample the wines before we made out choices. The manager walked us to our tables and carried our wine glasses...very classy.  The servers were incredible. Three to a table. The food was delicious. Shout out to the spanikopita, grilled calamari, meatballs and 5 spreads with pita. The wine was delicious. Loved the pink bang rose. Will definitely return.

originalText.text:
A coworker and I decided to come here and I gave her rave reviews of a dinner I had here pre pandemic days! We ordered spanakopita(good) calamari(perfectly cooked) lamb burgers (not seasoned at all) and the walnut cake(too sweet)

We had to run so ordered our dessert to go, boy was that a mistake. They didn’t even package the ice cream for us which it was supposed to come with. We were highly disappointed- and the walnut cake was so sweet!

I’m not sure I will visit here for lunch again, but may come back for dinner.

text.text:
A coworker and I decided to come here and I gave her rave reviews of a dinner I had here pre pandemic days! We ordered spanakopita(good) calamari(perfectly cooked) lamb burgers (not seasoned at all) and the walnut cake(too sweet)

We had to run so ordered our dessert to go, boy was that a mistake. They didn’t even package the ice cream for us which it was supposed to come with. We were highly disappointed- and the walnut cake was so sweet!

I’m not sure I will visit here for lunch again, but may come back for dinner.

originalText.text:
The waiters and overall staff are great people, and the walnut cake is to die for. Best dessert I ever had, usually I’m not a big fan of any nut type cake but this dessert was the best, highly recommend trying.

Reason I’m giving 3 stars (wanted to give 3 and half) is that the strawberry mojito is way to strong and not that good compared to other places that make mojitos which are refreshing. The chicken was way too dry for my taste.

Overall the atmosphere and the staff is great, I’ll give a second shot to try other entrees in future.

originalText.text: Decent food and drinks but way too many people which made it increasingly difficult to enjoy a conversation with my colleagues.  The table they sat us at was by the door and at least 25 people hit my chair as they went thru the door to go to the outside tables. With all the places to go to in Manhattan I probably wouldn’t go back.
